Crime_Name: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act Violation
Legal_Issue: Whether the Board committed a patently unreasonable error in concluding that the applicant had an internal flight alternative (IFA)
Application_Facts: The applicant claimed refugee status due to fear of persecution in Pakistan; the Board found inconsistencies and contradictions in testimony and considered documentation likely fraudulent
Decision_Outcome: The application for judicial review was dismissed
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Court_Ruling: No patently unreasonable error was found in the Board's decision
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of testimony, consistency of documents, prevalence of forged documentation in Pakistan
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review under subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Credibility_Assessment: The Board found the applicant's documents likely fraudulent due to inconsistencies and contradictions in testimony
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Basis: Refugee protection based on fear of persecution
Evidence_Assessed: Documentation submitted by the applicant, oral testimony
Governing_Rule: The applicant must prove, on a balance of probabilities, that there is a serious possibility of persecution throughout their country
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Inconsistencies and contradictions in testimony, likelihood of forged documents
Harm_Assessment: Alleged risk of persecution in Pakistan
Cause_Description: Applicant denied refugee status due to availability of an internal flight alternative (IFA) and credibility concerns
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed authenticity and consistency of documents and testimony
Legal_Provision: Subsection 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Documents deemed likely fraudulent; issues considered local rather than national in Pakistan
Decision_Rationale: No patently unreasonable error in finding an internal flight alternative and questioning credibility
Evidentiary_Issues: Contradictions in testimony, questionable authenticity of documents
